Government of Goa DIRECTORATE OF EDUCATION Alto - Porvorim, Bardez - Goa Email:- dir-educ.goa@nic.in Tel:-0832-2416023,2416033 Fax:- 0832-2416136 Dated:- & 3 /9/2019. No. Acad/Misc/MHRD/2017/2100 C U L A R In light of the various incidents of abuse of school going children on the way to and back from schools, it has become necessary that all possible steps are taken to ensure safety of school children in their journey to and from the school. An important step in this regard would be to have police verification carried out in respect of the drivers and helpers etc. of bus/van/auto-rickshaw ferrying school children. lt is instructed by the Ministry of Human Resource Development, New Delhi, that the staff may be engaged for ferrying school children only after police verification of their character and antecedents is completed. Moreover, with the passage of time, a person may be affected by many psycho-social factors in his immediate or distant environment. It would therefore be desirable that the police verification is repeated after every two years, so as to ensure continued safety of the children in their journey to and from the school. It is therefore enjoined upon all the Heads of the  Govt./Govt. aided/ Primary/Secondary/Higher secondary & Special Schools in the State of Goa to strictly adhere to the above instructions and stringent action will be taken against the school authorities in case of any violation/lapse with regard to the safety and well being of school children.  (Vandana Rao, IAS) Director of Education To, The Heads of Govt./Govt. Aided/Unaided Primary/Secondary /Higher Secondary & Special Schools in the State of Goa. Copy to:- 1. The Joint Secretary to the  Government of India, Ministry of Human Resource Development, Department of School Education & Literacy, Shastri Bhavan , New Delhi. 2. The Dy. Director of Education, North/South/Central Educational Zone, Mapusa/Margao/Panaji-Goa. 3. The ADEIs of all Taluka. /4/ The Nodal Officer, IT for uploading on website of this Directorate.

No. J-11013/30/2009-IA.II(I) Government of India Ministry of Environment & Forests Paryavaran Bhavan, C.G.O. Complex, Lodi Road, New Delhi-110003. Telefax: 24362434 Dated the 3 rd June, 2009 CIRCULAR Mandate / Guidelines of Monitoring to be followed by the Regional Sub: Offices of the Ministry of Environment and Forests — Instructions — Regarding. Some instances have been brought to the notice of the Ministry of Environment & Forests where Scientists or Officials of the Regional Offices of this Ministry have been directly interacting with various other Statutory and Regulatory Authorities on behalf of the project proponents on matters concerning the EIA Notification, 2006; such as exemption from public hearing, approval for change of technologies etc. 2. It may be noted that the Regional Offices are to monitor the implementation of the stipulated conditions and environmental safeguards contained in the Environmental Clearance letters, obviously after the project has been granted environmental clearance.  Sometimes the Regional Offices are formally requested by the Ministry to provide any specific information as may be requisite for appraisal of any particular project. In view of the above role, it has, therefore, been reiterated that the Regional Offices 3. should not take up issues of any project proponent with various Statutory Authorities directly. Such cases should be invariably referred to the Ministry for advice and guidance, henceforth. This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority. A A - D A - (S.K. Aggarwal) Director To All the Regional Offices of MoEF .1. .2. Member Secretaries of all the SEIAAs/SEACs Copy to:- . PPS to AS(JMM). Advisor (GKP) .2. .3. Advisor (NB) Director (SVA), Monitoring Cell, IA Division. .4.

MINISTRY OF LAW AND JUSTICE (Legislative Department) New Delhi, the 10th December, 2014/Agrahayana 19, 1936 (Saka) The following Act of Parliament received the assent of the President on the 9th December, 2014, and is hereby published for general information:— THE MERCHANT SHIPPING (AMENDMENT) ACT, 2014 (No. 31 of 2014) [9th December , 2014.] An Act further to amend the Merchant Shipping Act, 1958. B e it enacted by Parliament in the Sixty-fifth Year of the Republic of India as follows:- 1. ( 1 ) This Act may be called the Merchant Shipping (Amendment) Act, 2014. Short title and commencement. (2) It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint. 2. In the Merchant Shipping Act, 1958 (hereinafter referred to as the principal Act), 44 of 1958. Insertion of after Part XIA, the following Part shall be inserted, namely:— new Part IN XIB.  TART XIB C ONTROL OF HARMFUL ANTI-FOULING SYSTEMS ON SHIPS 356P. ( I ) Save as otherwise provided in this Part, this Part shall apply to— Application. ( a ) every Indian ship, wherever it is; b ) ships not entitled to fly the flag of India, but which operate under the authority of India;  and

RESERVE BANK OF INDIA. RBI/2019-2020/157 DOR.AML.BC.No.32/14.06.001/2019-20 February 07, 2020 The Chairpersons/CEOs of all the Regulated Entities Madam/Dear Sir, Implementation of Section 51A of Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA), 1967- Updates to ISIL (Da'esh) & Al-Qaida Sanctions List Please refer to Section 51 of our Master Direction on Know Your Customer dated February 25, 2016 as amended on January 09, 2020, in terms of which "Regulated Entities (REs) shall ensure that in terms of Section 51A of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) (UAPA) Act, 1967, they do not have any account in the name of individuals/entities appearing in the lists of individuals and entities, suspected of having terrorist links, which are approved by and periodically circulated by the United Nations Security Council (UNSC)." 2. In this regard, Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has now forwarded a press release SC/14097 dated February 04, 2020 titled 'Security Council ISIL (Da'esh) and Al-Qaida Sanctions Committee Adds one entry [QDi.425; AMADOU KOUFA of Malian origin] to its Sanctions List', issued by the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). The UNSC press releases concerning amendments to the list are available at URL: https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/sanctions/1267/press-releases 3. Updated lists of individuals and entities linked to ISIL (Da'esh), Al-Qaida and Taliban are available at: https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/sanctions/1267/aq_sanctions_list https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/sanctions/1988/materials 4. In view of the above, Regulated Entities (REs) are advised to ensure meticulous compliance with the aforementioned instruction pertaining to UAPA and ensure that they do not have any account in the name of individuals/entities appearing in the lists of individuals and entities, suspected of having terrorist links, circulated by the UNSC. Yours faithfully, (Dr. S. K. Kar) Chief General Manager विनियमन विभान, केंट्रीय कार्यालय, केंट्रीय कार्यालय भवन, 12वी/ 13वीं मंत्रिल, शहीद भगत सिंह मार्ग, फोर्ट, सुंचर्ट- 400001 टेलीफोन/  Tel No: 22661602, 22601000  फ़नग्र/  Fax No: 022-2270 5691 Department of Regulation, Central Office, Central Office Building, 12*' 13th Floor, Shahid Bhagat Singh Marg, Fort, Mumbai - 400001 हिंदी आखान है, इसका प्रयोग बढ़ाइप "Caution: RBI never sends malis, SMSs or makes calls asking for personal information like bank account details, passwords, etc. it never keeps or offers funds to anyone. By Speed Post/Fax No. Z-28016/60/2017-PMSSY-IV Government of India Ministry of Health & Family Welfare PMSSY Division) Nirman Bhawan, New Delhi. Dated the 5th July, 2017 To The Director, AllMS Bhopal      3090110 1 The Director, AIIMS Bhubaneswar 2. The Director, AllMS Jodhpur 3. The Director, AllMS Patna 4. The Director, AIIMS Raipur 5, The Director, AIIMS Rishikesh 6. Grant of Learning Resource Allowance (LRA) to Faculty and Group-A Officers Sub: of new AIIMS on the existing pattern of AIIMS New Delhi-regarding. Sir/Madam, I am directed to say that the matter regarding grant of Learning Resource Allowance (LRA) to Faculty members and Non-Faculty Group-A Officers of the six new AllMS on the basis of the recommendations of the SFC of new AllMS in consultation with their Finance Division has been examined in this Ministry. The proposal regarding grant of Learning Resource Allowance (LRA) to the Faculty members and Group 'A' Non-Faculty members of the new AIIMS, on the existing pattern of AllMS New Delhi , in-principle,  has been approved by Hon'ble Minister for Health & Family Welfare and the President of the New AIIMS Institutes. The LRA may be made applicable with effect from 01.04.2017. Directors of the new AllMS are advised to obtain required approval of 3. respective GB/IB before adopting the LRA Scheme on the above lines. However, those new AIIMS in which IB/GB have empowered Hon'ble Minister 4. for Health & Family Welfare and President of the Institute to take decision on LRA, may implement LRA in view of the approval of Hon’ble Minister for Health & Family Welfare.In such cases, the matter may be placed before IB for information/ratification in due course. For other new AIIMS, it is advised to place the matter for grant of LRA before 4. the GB for decision. Thereafter, the same may need to be ratified by IB. Yours faithfully, (ITBARI LAB Under Secretary to the Govt, of India Tel. 23061935

No. 47/5/2020-R&R Government of India Ministry of Power Shram Shakti Bhavan, Rafi Marg New Delhi, 5 th January, 2022 VACANCY CIRCULAR The Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) for Goa & UTs was set up by the Government of India under the provisions of the Electricity Act, 2003. The Commission is located at Gurgaon (Haryana). The Commission consists of a Chairperson and another Member. The post of Chairperson in the above JERC fell vacant on 17.9.2021.  It is proposed to fill up the vacancy. Appointment to the post of Chairperson, JERC for Goa & UTs is governed by the relevant provisions of the Electricity Act and the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Member) Rules, 2007 & Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Amendment Rules, 2021. .3. Section 84 (1) of the Electricity Act prescribes the qualification for appointment of a Member (including Chairperson) i.e. "….the Members of the State Commission shall be persons of ability, integrity and standing who have adequate knowledge of, and have shown in, dealing with, problems relating to engineering, finance, commerce, economics, law, or management." The Chairperson of JERC for Goa & UTs shall hold office for a term of .4. five years from the date on which he/ she enters upon his/ her office or till he/ she attains the age of sixty-five years, whichever is earlier.  The candidate will have to give a declaration that he/she does not have any financial or other interest, which is likely to affect prejudicially his/her function as Chairperson of the above JERC. .5. Relevant extracts of the Electricity Act, 2003 relating to the requirement of qualification, experience, etc. for Member, JERC for Goa & UTs and a copy of Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (Salaries, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Rules, 2007 & Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Amendment Rules, 2021 are attached with the vacancy circular posted at website of Ministry of Power i.e. www.powermin.nic.in.

No. R-11017/19/2017-L&M Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers' Welfare Office of Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies) Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi Dated 9th June, 2017 CIRCULAR Subject: Diversion of funds from core business to other activities - reg. It has been brought to the knowledge of this Department that some of the multi-state cooperative societies are diverting their funds from core business to other activities which is not as per the bye-laws approved by the Central Registrar. It is therefore, all the multi-state cooperative societies are hereby 2. directed that they should invest its funds as per the provision of section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002 read with bye-laws approved by the Central Registrar in this regard. In case of any diversion of funds from core business to other activities 3. which is not as per the approved bye-laws, severe action will be taken against the society including winding up as per the provisions of the MSCS Act, 2002. This has the approval of the Competent authority in this Department. . Social p (P. RESERVE BANK OF INDIA. RBI/2019-20/82 Ref.No.IDMD/1009/08.02.032/2019-20 October 14, 2019 All Scheduled Commercial Banks All State Co-operative Banks/All Scheduled Primary (Urban) Co-operative Banks/All Financial Institutions/ All Primary Dealers. Dear Sir/Madam, Auction of Government of India Dated Securities Government of India has offered to sell (re-issue) five dated securities for a notified amount of ₹16,000 crore as per the following details: Notified Sr ettlement Amount Security Gol Notification  Auction Date No date (in ₹ crore) 1 6.17% GS 2021 2,000 2 7.27% GS 2026 2,000 F.No.4(6) October 18, October 22, 3 6.45% GS 2029 7,000 W&M/2019 dated 2019 (Friday) 2019 (Tuesday) October 14, 2019 4 7.62% GS 2039 1,000 5 7.63% GS 2059 4,000 Total 16,000 Subject to the limit of ₹16000 Cr being total notified amount, Gol will have the option to retain additional subscription up to ₹1000 Cr each against any one or more of the above securities. The auction be price based using multiple price method. The Reserve Bank of India at Mumbai will conduct the auctions. The salient features of the auctions and the terms and conditions governing the issue of the Stocks are given in the notifications (copies enclosed), which should be read along with the General Notification F.No.4(2)–W&M/2018, dated March 27, 2018 issued by Government of India. 2. We wish to draw your attention, in particular, to the following: (i) The Stocks will be issued for a minimum amount of ₹10,000/- (nominal) and in multiples of ₹10,000/- thereafter. (ii) In all the auctions, Government Stock up to 5% of the notified amount of sale will be allotted to the eligible individuals and institutions under the Scheme for Non-competitive Bidding Facility in the Auctions of Government Securities. Each bank or PD on the basis of firm orders received from their constituents will submit a single consolidated non-competitive bid on behalf of all its constituents in electronic format on the Reserve Bank of India Core Banking Solution (E-Kuber) system. Allotment under the non-competitive segment to the bank or PD will be at the weighted average rate of yield/price that will emerge in the auction on the basis of the competitive bidding.

MOST IMMEDIATE Y EMAIL F.No.4/9/1/2014-IR Government of India Ministry of Finance Department of Financial Services Jeevan Deep, Illrd Floor, Parliament  Street, New Delhi Dated the August 8,2014 To Chairman, SBI/CMDs of all Public Sector Banks including IDBI and SBI Associates Subject: Transfer of female employees in Public Sector Banks – minimizing their hardship. Sir, It has been brought to the notice of this Department that female employees of Public Sector Banks (PSBs), married or unmarried, when placed/transferred away from their husband or parents, as the case may be , to distant locations face a genuine hardship and develop a feeling of insecurity. Keeping this in view, it has been decided: to accommodate  as far as possible placement/transfer of married (i) female employee,  on her request, at a place where her husband is stationed or as near as possible to that place or vice versa; and (li) to accommodate as far as possible  placement/transfer of unmarried female employee, on her request, at a place where her parents, are stationed or as near as possible to that place. PSBs  are, therefore, advised to frame a policy on the subject with the 2. approval of their Board suitably incorporating the above and take immediate action for implementation and compliance.  Pending requests may also be considered under these guidelines. A line of confirmation may be sent to this Department immediately after adoption of the policy by the Board of the Bank. This issues with the approval of Secrtary(Financial Services). 3. ours faithfully, Manish Kumar) Under Secretary to the Government of India  Encl: a.a. Copy to : The Chief Executive, Indian Banks' Association, Bombay.

No. R-11017/10/2013-L&M (Pt.) Government of India Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers' Welfare Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi Dated  17''' August, 2016 OFFICE OF THE CENTRAL REGISTRAR OF COOPERATIVE SOCIETIES C I R C U L A R It has been brought to the notice of this Department that certain cooperative societies registered under the State Cooperative Societies Acts are depicting themselves as multi-state cooperative societies by claiming extension of their area of operation to other States/UTs without any registration from the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies. In this connection, it is brought to the knowledge of the States/UTs that a State .2. Cooperative Society can be converted into a multi-State cooperative society under section 22 of the MSCS Act, 2002.  After receiving the proposal from the society in this Department, the Registrar of Cooperative Societies (RCS) of the concerned States/UTs, where the society proposes to extend their area of operation are consulted on this matter before considering registration by conversion under the MSCS Act, 2002. After that a certificate of registration is issued to the cooperative society stating that it has been converted as a multi-State cooperative society and a copy of the same is marked to the concerned RCS of the States/UTs. 3. It is therefore, the authorities of the States/UTs may kindly take note of the above and if any State cooperative society is found depicting itself as a multi-State cooperative society, a strict vigil may be kept on them and their certificate of registration may be examined and verified to know their status, and if it is found that the society is claiming false status, strict action may please be taken against them and if any doubt arises regarding their status, please contact the Central Registrar immediately. (Ashish Kumar Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies & Joint Secretary to the Government of India ☎ : 011-23389208 Distribution :- 1) Chief Secretary of all States/UTs 2)   Principal Secretary (Cooperation) of all States/UTs 3) Registrar of Cooperative societies of all States/UTs.

संख्या- 11034/4/2023 - राजभाषा (नीति) गृह  मन्नालय राजभाषा  विभाग एनडीसीसी-।।  भवन, चौथा  तल, जय सिंह रोड, नई दिल्ली-110001 दिनांक : 04 मई, 2023 कार्यालय  ज्ञापन् संघ सरकार की राजभाषा नीति के अन्पालन में राजभाषा विभाग, गृह मंत्रालय दवारा समय-समय पर विभिन्न प्रकार के आदेश, कार्यालय ज्ञापन, नियम एवं निर्देश आदि जारी किए जाते हैं। इन आदेशों को संकलित करके अलग-अलग वर्षो  में  मुद्रित/प्रकाशित  कराया  जाता  रहा  है।  राजभाषा का प्रविभाग का प्रकोश का संघ का सरकार का प्रकोकेश का विभिन्न 2. 2. मंत्रालयों/विभागों/कार्यालयों/स्वायत निकायों और संगठनों आदि से अनुरोध प्राप्त होते रहते हैं, जिनमें आदेशों, नियमों आदि की प्रतियां आदि उपलब्ध कराने के अनुरोध शामिल होते हैं। कभी-कभी आदेशों के संकलन सुलभ न होने से प्रयोक्ताओं/प्रशासकों को कठिनाई का सामना करना पड़ता है। 3. राजभाषा संबंधी आदेशों के सभी उपलब्ध संकलनों को डिजिटाइज करा लिया गया है और इन्हें पीडीएफ फॉर्मेट में, राजभाषा विभाग की वेबसाइट पर उपलब्ध कराया जा रहा है। बाद में, अन्य महत्वपूर्ण दस्तावेजों को भी वेबसाइट पर पीडीएफ रूप र्मे  उपलब्ध  कराया  जाएगा।

SECRETARY DEPARTMENT OF PERSONNEL & TRAINING Tel. : 23092370 त्यमेर  अयते MINISTRY OF PERSONNEL, PUBLIC GRIEVANCES Fax: 23093142 AND PENSIONS NORTH BLOCK, NEW DELHI-110001 D.O. No. 33/2014-EO(MM.II) Dated: 3 December, 2013 Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to invite nominations of officers for appointment on deputation to posts under the Central Staffing Scheme for the year 2014. The detailed guidelines for nominating suitable officers are given in Appendix. I would request that the guidelines are strictly adhered to, while drawing up the offer list, While forwarding names of officers, you may also like to take note of the fact that about 30% of the posts under the Central Staffing Scheme are of the rank of Joint Secretary and above, and the remaining 70% of the posts are at the level of Director/Deputy Secretary i.e. the Middle Management level. The list that you forward, to this Office, should comprise the names of officers at different levels, so that it caters to the requirement of personnel at varying levels under the Government of India. As you might be aware, considerable process and exercise are gone through before .3. an officer is appointed under the Central Staffing Scheme. However, very often, the Cadre Controlling Authorities withdraw the names of officers from offer at an advanced stage of processing. This results in considerable delay in the placement of officers under the Central Staffing Scheme, which is not in public interest. Therefore, the Government of India has been following a policy of debarring an officer for five years, if, once appointed by the Government under the Central Staffing Scheme, he does not join the post either on account of personal disinclination, or the refusal of the Cadre to relieve him. Much as we would like to indicate very early the possibility of placement in respect of the officers in the list, the Central Staffing Scheme lays down detailed consultations with the borrowing Ministries/ Departments. Hence, it is difficult to forecast placements in advance. It is also to be highlighted that it is not only the failure to take up the appointment, but also withdrawal of the name of an officer after a panel has been recommended by the Civil Services Board, that results in debarment for five years. As per instructions contained in letter No. 14/1/98- FA(UN), dated 26.2.1998 and No.1/1/2003-FAS, dated 8.5.2003 of the Department of Personnel and Training, an officer who is debarred from being taken on deputation to a post under the Central Staffing Scheme is also to be debarred from being given Cadre Clearance for foreign assignments/consultancies abroad during the period of debarment. Therefore, you are earnestly requested to ensure that an officer, once placed on the offer list, continues to be available for consideration throughout the year and his name is not withdrawn during this period, save under exceptional circumstances. In the recent past, it has been observed that some individual officers whose name has been placed on the offer list have represented directly to this office for withdrawal of their names from the offer list citing personal reasons चना  का

References with regard to applicability of provision of PC/RAKSHA/63060/Q/ST- 5/3633/D(QS) dated 26" Septemebr 2006 have been received from various IFAs 2. The issue has been examined and it is initimated that as per Para.7 of DFPDS-2016, where SOP/Servce specific instructions/IFA Manuals conflict with the basic Government Rules/Orders/DPM/present MoD Order, the latter will prevail and immediate action will be taken to amend the SOP/Service-specific instructions/IFA Manual. CGDA (Finance). AO (IFA) Copy to: IFA IMA For information and  necessary action w.r.t. letter No. Dehradun IFA(A)/DDN/001/IDAS Corr Vol IV dated 24.01.2018. AO (IFA)

राजस्थान सरकार नगरीय विकास एवं आवासन विभाग क्र,  प.2(18)नविवि / 5 / 2009  पार्ट – VIII जयपुर, दिनांक   2. 3. 4- 18 आदेश जयपुर  विकास  प्राधिकरण  द्वारा  अवगःःःः  कराया  गया  है  कि,  अफॉडेबल  ह: उसिंग पॉलिसी—2009 के अन्तर्गत आवंटियों में से कुछ आवंटियों की समय पर सूचना नही मिलने कारण आंशिक राशि जमा होने से शेष रह मई है। अधिकांश मामलों में बकाया राशि रु 5000/ – से भी कम है। इन आवाटियों में से अधिकाशं ने विभिन्न वैकों/संस्थाओं से आवास ऋण लेकर राशि जमा कराई है तथा ऋणदात्री संस्थाओं द्वारा ऋण पर 'प्रतिमाह किश्त की वसूली की जा रही है। ऐसी रिथति में इन आवंटियों के आवास निरस्त किये जाने की स्थिति में आवंटी द्वारा जमा कराई गई  राशि में से नियमानुसार 10 प्रतिशत राशि की कटाती कर शेष राशि का भ्गतान जयपुर  विकास  प्राधिकरण  द्वारा  आवंटी  को  किये  जाने  पर  ऐसे  आवंटियों  पर अत्याधिक आर्थिक भार पडेगा।  उपरोक्त रिथिति के मध्यनजर जनहित में यह निर्णय लिया गया है कि  अफोडेबल हाउसिंग पॉलिसी—2009 के अन्तर्गत ऐसे आवंटी जिनकी बकाया राशि रु 5000/— तक है तथा आदेश जारी होने की तिथि से एक माह की अवधि में बकाया राशि संबंधित – प्राधिकरण / न्यास / रथानीय – निकाय – में – जमा – कराते – हैं – तो प्राधिकरण / न्यास / रथानीय  निकाय  द्वारा  आवास  निरस्तीकरण  की  कार्यवाही  नही  की जावे ।  यह आदेश तुरन्त प्रभाव से लागू होगा ।  राज्यपाल  की  आज्ञा  से, संयुक्त  शासन  सचिव–प्रथम

सं0 14034/30/2009-रा0$110 (प्रशि0) गूह  मंत्रालय राजभाषा  विभाग लोकनायक भवन, खान मार्केट, नई  दिल्ली,  दिनांक  6  ज़नवरी,  2010 कार्यालय  जापन विषय:- छठे वेतन आयोग की सिफारिशों के आलोक में वर्ग "घ" से वर्ग "ग" में आए कार्मिकों के लिए हिंदी भाषा, हिंदी टंकण का प्रशिक्षण देने के संबंध में| छठे वैतन आयोग की रिपोर्ट के अध्याय 2.2.9 के अनुसार वर्ग "घ" कार्मिको को वर्ग "ग" वेतन वर्ग में शामिल कर लिया गया है। चूंकि महामहिम राष्ट्रपति के अप्रैल, 1960 के आदेशानूसार वर्ग 'ग' कार्मिको के लिए हिंदी भाषा और हिंदी टंकण का प्रशिक्षण अनिवार्य है, अतः विभाग में इस मामले पर विचार-विमर्श के बाद यह निर्णय लिया गया है कि वर्ग "घ" से वर्ग "ग" में आए उन कार्मिकों के लिए जो वर्ग "ग" श्रेणी के लिए निर्धारित शैक्षिक योग्यता रखते हैं, को उनकी पात्रतानुसार हिंदी आषा और हिंदी टंकण का प्रशिक्षण दिया जाए| .12. प्रशिक्षण प्रासि के बाद निर्धारित परीक्षा उतीर्ण करने पर ये कार्मिक अग्रिम वैयक्तिक वेतन एवं नकद पुरस्कार पाने के हकदार होंगे। ये आदेश केंद्र सरकार के मंत्रालयो/विभागो/अधीनस्थ एवं सम्बद्ध कार्यालयो/वैंको/ निगमो/ निकार्यो .3. आदि के सभी कार्मिकों पर लागू होंगे तथा कार्यालय जापन जारी होने की तारीख से प्रभावी होंगे। के लिए प्रस्ता विजय  कुमार  गुसा) अवर  सचिव  (प्रशि0) सेवा  में, भारत सरकार के सभी मंत्रालय/विभाग (अनुरोध है कि कृपया इस कार्यालय जापन की विषय .1. वस्तु को अपने नियंत्रणाधीन सभी सरकारी उपक्रमो/वैंको/स्वायत संगठनो/नियमों आदि के ध्यान में लाएं) .12. भारत के नियंत्रक तथा महालेखा परीक्षक का कार्यालय, नई दिल्ली । संघ लोक सेवा आयोग, नई दिल्ली । .3. केन्द्रीय सतर्कता आयोग, नई दिल्ली । .4. आरत के निर्वाचन आयोग का कार्यालय, नई दिल्ली । .15. सचिव, संसदीय राजभाषा समिति, 11, तीन मूर्ति मार्ग, नई दिल्ली । .6.6. गृह मंत्रालय और राजभाषा विभाग के सभी संबद्ध एवं अधीनस्थ कार्यालय । .17. सभी संघ शासित क्षेत्र । 8. राजभाषा विभाग के सभी अधिकारी एवं डेस्क/अनुभाग/ 9. 10. निदेशक, केन्द्रीय हिंदी प्रशिक्षण संस्थान, 7वॉ तल, पर्यावरण भवन, नई दिल्ली ।

(TO BE PUBLISHED IN THE GAZETTE OF INDIA PART-I SECTION-1) No.F.12-26/2010-Skt.(U.3A) Government of India Ministry of Human Resource Development Department of Higher Education ICR Division Shastri Bhawan, New Delhi Dated: /&April, 2019 NOTIFICATION Whereas, the Central Government is empowered under Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 to declare, on the advice of the UGC, an institution of higher learning as a deemed-to-be-university. 2. And whereas, in exercise of the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956, the Central Government vide its Notification No.9-28/2000-U.3 dated 07.05.2002, on the advice of UGC, had declared Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi consisting of its eight multi-campuses located at Lucknow, Allahabad, Jaipur, Sringeri, Trichur, Puri, Jammu & Garil (Kangra, Himachal Pradesh) as an "Institution Deemed to be University", subject to a review after five years. And further whereas, the Central Government, vide Notification No. 9-28/2000-U.3 dated 01.01.2009, on the advice of the UGC, extended the status of Deemed to be University of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi for a further period of five years i.e. upto 06.05.2012. .3. And whereas, the Central Government, vide Notification No. 9-28/2000-U.3 dated 30.06.2009, on the advice of the UGC, permitted Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan (Deemed to be University), New Delhi to bring the Bhopal and Mumbai Campus under its ambit as constituent teaching units. And further whereas, the Central Government, vide its Notification No. 9-28/2000-U3(Pt.1) dated 13th February, 2019, extended the status of Deemed to be University of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi from 07.05.2012 onwards. And whereas, Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi submitted an application .4.4. for starting of an Off-Campus Centre at Agartala, Tripura. The application was forwarded to UGC for examination and advice. UGC examined the application with the help of its Expert Committee. The report of Expert Committee was considered by the Commission in its 503rd meeting held on 22.09.2014 and recommended for approval the proposal for establishing of off-Campus centre of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan at Agartala, Tripura. The said recommendation of UGC was conveyed to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi by this Ministry on 5th December, 2016. Page 1 of 3

NT-OIL POL(1)/2005  Subject: Levy of Oil Cess under Section 356 (m) of M.S. Act and M.S. (Oil Pollution Cess Levy) Rules, 1988 All stake holders involved in the transportation of oil in bulk as cargo on oil tankers under Annex I of MARPOL 73/78 employed in the carriage of oil imported into India or shipped from any place in India in bulk as cargo of a ship are obliged to pay oil Cess at the  prescribed rate of 50 paise per ton to the Central Government.  The Cess is being collected at all major ports by Dy. Conservators and minor ports by the Port Officers or other designated Officers. The Directorate General of Shipping has been receiving queries to the applicability of Oil Cess levy to the types of oils.  It is hereby informed that the Oil Cess shall be payable by the ship owners or his agent or Master prior to the discharge of cargo at any Indian port or ports as petroleum in any form including crude oil, fuel oil, sludge, oil refuse and refine products (other than petro-chemicals which are subject to the provisions of Annex II or MARPOL 73/78) persistent and non-persistent oil carried by the oil tanker in bulk as cargo. All Dy. Port Conservators of major Indian ports, State Port Officers of Maritime Boards and Port Officers of minor / captive ports are directed to collect the Oil Cess on the import or shipped cargo of oil in bulk on oil tankers under the provisions of MARPOL 73/78 Annex. I Regulation 1 (1) and Regulation 12 (2)(a) to (f). Yours faithfully, Sd/- (Capt. V. Baijal) Dy.Nautical Adviser to the Government of India 21 st October 2005

GOVERNMENT OF INDIA (BHARAT SARKAR) MINISTRY OF RAILWAYS (RAIL MANTRALAYA) (RAILWAY BOARD) NO.E (G) 2008 QR1-15 New Delhi, Dated: 18/12/2014 The General Managers,  All Indian Railways/Production Units, As per standard list ). Sub:  Retention of Railway accommodation at their previous place of posting by Railway official on deputation to Railway PSUs beyond 30-06-2014. The question of allowing house retention beyond 30-06-2014 to the Railway officers/statt on their deputation to Railway PSUs have been considered by the Board and it has been decided as under; a) The officers presently on deputation to Railway PSUs may be allowed to retain their Pathvay accommodation for their entire tenure, including the extended tenure (if any) of deputation. b)  The officers on deputation to PSUs situated in areas other than Delhi/NCR may be allowed retention of Railway accommodation for the next two years Le, w.e.f. 01-07-2014 to 30-06-2016 2. Please acknowledge receipt. (P.P.Sharma) Executive Director Estt.(Gen.)

MARG, Fax: 91-22-22613655 Email: dgship@dgshipping.com मुंबई / MUMBAI 400 001 Web: www.dgshipping.com R DG Shipping Order No. 16 of 2013:  NO: ENG/Misc.29(73)/09 Dated: 6 th June 2013 Subject: Liaison Branches for Technical Services at the Directorate General of  र Shipping, Mumbai- reg. The Directorate General of Shipping [DGS], Ministry of Shipping [MOS], Govt. of India [GOI] is the designated maritime administration for the shipping industry & its allied sectors in India. As a service oriented organization, intended for public interest, it provides multiple services, including, inter-alia, registration, survey, inspection, certification, approval, license & sanction.  Various stakeholders in these sectors are the recipients of the operational services of the DGS, GOI. The Directorate discharges its mandated functions, under the provisions of various statutes, inter-alia, the Merchant Shipping [M.S.] Act, 1958, as amended and the Rules framed there-under and in accordance with the various international maritime Conventions and Codes. In the contemporaneous era of a globalised & competitive business & techno¬ financial environment for the shipping industry, there is a critical & imperative need for the DGS to reorient itself to render such public services better, faster and with 'utmost transparency, more than even before, to stay relevant, responsible & resporisive to the rising aspirations of the industry. In this context, the need to re-engineer the business processes & procedures of the Directorate General of Shipping, GOI and its allied field offices, ic. the Mercantile Marine Departments [MMDs], etc., cannot be over-emphasized.

No. J.21011/58/2010-IA-I Government of India Ministry of Environment and Forests Paryavaran Bhawan CGO Complex, Lodi Boad New Delhi - 110 003 April 30, 2013 Dated; 1 OFFICE MEMÒRANDUM Consideration Sub: of proposals from Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg  districts, Maharashtra. This has reference to the Ministry's Office Memorandum of even No. dated 16 th August, 2010 and its subsequent amendments including amendment issued on 28" March 2013 extension of moratorium upto 30" April, 2013 on consideration of projects from the districts of Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg, Maharashtra under the EIA Notification, 2006 by this Ministry or by the Maharashtra State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA). The Ministry had constituted a High Level Working Group under the Chairmanship of Dr. K. Kasturirangan, Member, Planning Commission, vide office order dated 17.8.2012 to inter alia examine the Western Ghats Ecology Expert Panel Report in a holistic and multidisciplinary fashion keeping in view the comments received from the concerned State Governments/Central Ministries/Stakeholders. The working Group has since submitted its report to the Ministry which is under examination. Keeping in view the above and in continuation of the OM of 28" March, 2013, the moratorium for consideration of projects from Sindhudurg and Ratnagiri districts, Maharashtra is further extended upto 31 38 July, 2013. This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority. ( TO BE PUBLISHED IN THE GAZETTE OF INDIA PART-I SECTION-1 ) No. F.9-46/2004-U.3 Government of India Ministry of Human Resource Development (Department of Higher Education) ICR Division Shastri Bhawan, New Delhi-1, Dated the 16 h. December, 2019 NOTIFICATION Whereas, the Central Government is empowered under Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 to declare, on the advice of the UGC, an Institution of higher learning as deemed to be University. And whereas, in exercise of the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, .12. 1956, the Central Government, vide its Notification No. 9-46/2004-U.3 dated 17th January, 2007, on the advice of UGC, had declared Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Village Piparia, Taluka Waghodia, District Vadodara (Gujarat) consisting of the following four Institutions as an Institution Deemed to be University under Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 subject to a review after five years: i. K. M. shah Dental College and Hospital, Village Piparia, Taluka Waghodia, District Vadodara (Gujarat), ii. K. J. Pandya College of Physiotherapy, Village Piparia, Taluka Waghodia, District Vadodara (Gujarat), iii. S.B.K.S. Medical Institute and Research Centre, Village Piparia, Taluka Waghodia, District Vadodara (Gujarat), and Sumandeep Nursing College, Village Piparia, Taluka Waghodia, District Vadodara iv. (Gujarat). .13. And whereas, the UGC constituted an Expert Committee to examine the performance and academic outcomes of the Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Vadodara (Gujarat). The Committee, in its report, gave the very good grade to Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Vadodara (Gujarat) on academic performance of the Institution and recommended for continuation of their Deemed to be University status. The report of the UGC Committee was considered by the Commission in its 544 th meeting (Item No.2.12) held on 16.10.2019 in which the following resolution was passed: The Commission considered the report of the UGC Expert Standing Committee and resolved to continue/extend Deemed to be University status for those Institutions who were rated Excellent, Very Good & Good for academic performance by the Expert Committee. However, those Deemed to be Universities which were rated poor and average for academic performance will not be granted continuation / extension." Page 1 of 2

भारत सरकार   GOVERNMENT OF INDIA RBE 20. रील मेबालय   MINISTRY OF RAILWAYS ( ऐससे सोडे   RAILWAY BOARD) in ver. villagin-110001. 1 Rail Bhavan, New Delhibinoco No. E(G)2005 QR1-13. The General Managers, All Indian Railways/PUs and others. Sub: Retention of Railway accommodation by staff of Railway Audit Department in the event of transfer from one place to another necessitating change of residence. Ministry of Railways have reviewed the instructions governing retention of Railway accommodation by staff of Railway Audit Department in the event of transfer from one place to another necessitating change of residence contained in para 1.5 of Annexure of Railway Board's letter No. E(G)85 QR1-9 dated 15/1/90 and letter No. E(G)2005 QR1-13 dated 6/3/2006. In supersession of the above instructions it has been decided that since the staff of Railway. Audit Department also encounter the same difficulties of dislocation on transfer from one place to another and have to apply to the same Quarter Controlling Authorities for allotment of Railway accommodation as the Railway employees, staff of Railway Audit Department may be extended similar facilities for retention of Railway accommodation in the event of transfer necessitating change of residence as extended to Railway employees as per para 1 of Board's letter No. E(G)2000 QR1-23 dated 1/6/2001. Accordingly, the following provision is added as Item (d) under para 1 of Board's letter No. E(G)2000 QR1-23 dated 1/6/2001 and may be deemed to be part of the instructions from that date: "(d) These instructions will also be applicable to the employees of Railway Audit Department in allotment and occupation of Railway accommodation." Further, instructions issued from time to time pertaining to retention of Railway accommodation by Railway employees in the event of posting to new Zones/Divisions shall also be applicable to the employees of Railway Audit Department.

संख्या- 245/2023/ 29 पी /23-27-सिं0-4-1(डब्ल्यू)परि0/2023 प्रेषक, अमित प्रणव, संयुक्त सचिव, उत्तर प्रदेश शासन। सेवा में, प्रमुख अभियन्ता एवं विभागाध्यक्ष, सिंचाई एवं जल संसाधन विभाग,  उOप्त0, लखनऊ। सिंचाई एवं जल संसाधन अनुभाग-4 लखनऊ: दिनांक: 23 मई, 2023 विषय:  "बेलवनिया माईनर की पुनर्स्थापना की परियोजना की प्रशासकीय एवं वित्तीय स्वीकृति " के सम्बन्ध में।  1 महोदय, उपर्युक्त विषयक प्रमुख अभियन्ता (परियोजना), सिंचाई एवं जल संसाधन विभाग, COHO लेखनऊ के पत्र संख्या-33/परियोजना/कैम्प/बजट, दिनांक 20 अप्रैल, 2023 के सन्दर्भ में मुझे यह कहने का निदेश हुआ है कि "बेलबनिया  माईनर की पुनर्स्थापना की परियोजना की विल्तीय स्वीकृति " लागत रू0 1219.71 लाख की प्रशासकीय स्वीकृति एवं वित्तीय वर्ष 2023-24 में लेखाशीर्षक-4701-06-051-10-06-24 के अन्तर्गत प्राविधानित बजट व्यवस्था धनराशि रू0 600.00 लाख के सापेक्ष प्रथम किश्त के रूप में रू0 304.90 लाख (रूपये तीन करोड़ चार लाख नब्बे हजार मात्र ) निम्नांकित शर्तों के अधीन अवमुक्त किये जाने की श्री राज्यपाल सहर्ष स्वीकृति प्रदान करते हैं:- प्रश्नगत परियोजना के कार्य प्रारम्भ करने से पूर्व वित्तीय हस्तपुस्तिका खण्ड-6 के अध्याय-12 के 1- प्रस्तर-318 में वर्णित व्यवस्था के अनुसार प्रायोजना पर सक्षम स्तर पर तकनीकी स्वीकृति अवश्य प्राप्त कर ली जाएगी तथा सक्षम स्तर से तकनीकी स्वीकृति प्राप्त होने के पश्चात् ही कॉर्य प्रारम्भ किया जाएगा। प्रायोजना पर मात्राओं को निर्माण के समय सुनिश्चित किए जाने का पूर्ण उत्तरदायित्व कार्यदायी -2- संस्था/ विभाग का होगा। प्रायोजना का निर्माण कार्य ससमय पूर्ण करा लिया जाना सुनिश्चित किया जायेगा। -3- परियोजना हेतु स्वीकृत धनराशि का व्यय प्रबन्धन विल्तीय हस्तपुस्तिकाओं के सुसंगत प्राविधानों के 4- अन्तर्गत तथा मितव्ययिता के सम्बन्ध में बिल्त विभाग द्वारा समय-समय पर निर्गत शासनादेशों में निहित प्राविधानों का अनुपालन सुनिश्चित किया जाएगा। स्वीकृत धनराशि का उपयोग स्वीकृत प्रायोजना पर ही किया जायेगा, अन्यथा की स्थिति में किसी 5- प्रकार की अनियमितता के लिए इसका समस्त उत्तरदायित्व विभाग का होगा। स्वीकृत धनराशि कोषोगार से एकमुश्त न आहरित कर आवश्यकतानुसार आहरित कर व्यय किया 6- जायेगा तथा आहरित धनराशि बैंक/डॉक घर/डिपोजिट में न रखी जाय। प्रायोजना पर नियमानुसार समस्त वैधानिक अनापत्तियाँ एवं पर्यावरणीय क्लीयरेन्स सक्षम स्तर से 7- प्राप्त करके ही निर्माण ँकार्य प्रारम्भ कराया जायेगा। प्रायोजनात्तर्गत प्रस्तावित कार्यों की द्विरावृत्ति (इप्लीकेसी) को रोकने की दृष्टि से प्रमुख अभियन्ता एवं 8- विभागाध्यक्ष द्वारा यह सुनिश्चित किया जोयेगा कि यह कार्य पूर्व में किसी अन्य योजना/कार्यक्रम के अन्तर्गत न तो स्वीकृत हैं और न वर्तमान में किसी अन्ये योजनों/कार्यक्रम में आच्छादित किया जाना प्रस्तावित है। परियोजनान्तर्गत अधिष्ठान व्यय/सेन्टेज की धनराशि समय-समय पर स्वीकृत/अवमुक्त की जा रही धनराशि के सापेक्ष जमा की जायेगी। अधिष्ठान व्यय पर वित्त (लेखा) अनुभाग-2 के शासनादेश संख्या-ए-2-23/दस 2011-17(4)/75, दिनांक 25 जनवरी, 2011 के साथ पठित शासनादेश संख्या- ए-2-1606/दस-2014-17(4)/75, दिनांक 11 नवम्बर, 2014 में निहित दिशा-निर्देशों के अनुसार कार्यवाही सुनिश्चित की जायेगी। परियोजना के अन्तर्गत कराये जाने वाले कार्यों पर 1 प्रतिशत लेबर सेस की धनराशि इस शर्त के अधीन 10- होगी कि श्रम विभाग को उक्त धनराशि का भुगतान किया जाएगा। प्रश्नगत निर्माण कार्य हेतु कार्यदायी संस्था द्वारा आवश्यकतानुसार धनराशि कोषागार से आहरित की 11- जायेगी।  उक्त परियोजनॉ हेतु अवमुक्त की जा रही धनराशि का व्यय विल्त विभाग के कार्यालेय ज्ञाप संज्या-2/2023/वी-1-227/दस-2023-231/2023, दिनांक 17 मार्च, 2023 एवं वित्तीय

No. Z-28016/24/2014-SSH Government of Indian Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (PMSSY Division) Nirman Bhawan, Maulana Azad Road, New Delhi-110011 Dated of May, 2015 CIRCULAR NO.01 PMSSY- MAY, 2015 Subject: Reconstitution of Selection Committees for filling Faculty/Non– up Faculty/Resident/Contractual Posts in New AIIMS- Consolidated Orders/Instructions/Guidelines - thereof. The Ministry has been receiving references from the new AIIMS for filling up various positions in Faculty/Non Faculty, Engagement of Residents as well as Contractual appointments to Faculty posts. Moreover, concerns regarding appointments to various Group A, B, and C posts have also been raised. The above issues have been in consideration of the Ministry for some time now, in the light of the circulars issued on 4" April 2013, 6" August 2013 and 18" July 2014. Accordingly it has been decided by the competent authority that the new AIIMS would require to be armed with certain delegated powers, streamlining of procedures, so as to bring about an effective turnaround in building up homan resources. Keeping in view the above scenario, the Ministry, after careful consideration regarding . the functional requirements, the need for expeditious recruitment and the procedural and other aspects reflected in relevant provisions under the AIIMS Act 1956, read with the AIIMS(Amendment) Act 2012, the AIIMS Rules 1958 and AIIMS Regulation 1999 as applicable, have set out to bring about consolidation of the various Instruction/Guidelines/Orders regulating the recruitment to various posts, as detailed below. SELECTION COMMITTEE FOR REGULAR APPOINTMENT TO FACULTY . POSTS The Committee for selection of Faculty posts, to be filled only on regular basis in the six new AllMS, will be the Standing Selection Committee(SSC) of the respective new AllMS as notified vide MoH&FW Order No Z- 28016/42/2013 dated 17th February 2015 under heading "Standing Selection Committee", in pursuance to the decision taken in the iirst meeting of the Institute Bodies(IBs) of the six New All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AllMS) thereby authorising the President (Hon'ble Health & Family Welfare Minister) to constitute, inter alia the Standing Selection Committee as per relevant provisions of the AIIMS Act 1956, as amended by AIIMS Amendment Act, 2012 .

No. AICTE/P&AP/Misc/2022/ CIRCULAR To All Vice Chancellors of Technical Universities and All Directors/ Principals of AICTE Approved Institutions, AICTE Guidelines for inclusive education for all including persons with Subject: disabilities. Sir/Madam, The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 emphasizes equal opportunity for education for all, irrespective of caste, gender and abilities including Persons with Disabilities (PwDs). The introduction of the National Education Policy 2020 has accelerated the need for creation of an 'inclusive education' system that caters to students with both visible and invisible disabilities. As a step towards inclusive and equitable quality education, the NEP 2020 presents a reasoning case for provisions and implementation plans aimed at promoting accommodation of students with any type of disabilities into the Indian education system. The policy touches several grounds to address issues surrounding identification and engagement of students with disabilities, along with the creation of an enabling ecosystem. In order to facilitate inclusive digital education for all, including Persons with Disabilities, AICTE has formulated following guidelines to be followed by AICTE Approved Institutions. 1) All AICTE Approved Institutions should establish a Cell known as "Equal Opportunity Facilitation Cell (EOFC)" with the following composition: EQFC Sr. No. Designation Senior faculty Nodal officer/Coordinator of EOFC . Member 2. Male/Female faculty Member Male/Female Non-Teaching staff .3. Member Male/Female student . Representative of NGO working in the area of Member .5. Empowerment of PWDs Member Secretary Registrar/Admin officer .6. The roles and responsibilities of the above Cell are summarized below: To promote admission of PwDs in technical institutions. a) To Create awareness among stakeholders in the area of equal opportunities on a b) regular basis. To address special needs of the students pertaining to teaching-learning process. c) d) To provide special assistance in training and placement of students with disabilities. To provide free laptops and internet charges to PwDs through Institute/State e). Government. To establish a teacher-mentor scheme for PwDs right from entry to exit from the ) institute. Develop disabled friendly teaching-learning process making use of modern tools ( g ) and assistive technologies

AV.15029/006/2008-AS Government of India Ministry of Civil Aviation "B" Block, Rajiv Gandhi Bhavan, SafdarjungAirport, New Delhi – 110003. Date : 08.03.2011 To The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security [BCAS], [Atten: Shri G.S. Malhi, COSCA], Janpath Bhavan, Janpath, New Delhi. Subject: Formulation of policy of Rotation/Transfer of officers of BCAS. Sir, am directed to refer to the guidelines of Central Vigilance i Commission [CVC], vide their letters No.98/VGL/60 dated 15.4.1999 & 2.11.2001 and No.004/VGL/90 dated 1.5.2008, which stipulate that officers working on sensitive posts & organisations should be rotated every two/three years and to say that in order to implement the CVC's guidelines it has been decided that the following rotation/transfer be implemented for the officers working in the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security [BCAS]: (i) The tenure of an officer in one particular seat in any station shall be 3 years. The combined tenure of an officer in a particular station (except Delhi) :  (ii)  shall be five years in the case of Sr. Dy. COS (CA) / Dy. COS (CA). (iii) The combined tenure of an officer in a particular station (except Delhi) in the case of Asstt. COS (CA) shall be 6 years. The combined tenure of an officer in a particular station in the case of (iv) Security Officer/ Sub-Inspector shall be 7 years. On promotion, an officer of the level of sub inspector and above shall (v) be posted out of the station where he is currently posted. (vi) If an officer has only two year of service to retire, he shall not as far as possible, be transferred to another station. (vii) For the purpose of these guidelines, the posting in Regional Headquarters at Delhi and BCAS Headquarters are considered as two separate offices. However, the combined tenure shall not exceed 7 years in case of Sr.Dy.COSCA/Dy.COSCA, Addl.COSCA and Security Officer in Delhi. After every posting in the Regional offices, the officers shall be posted (viii) to the BCAS Headquarters to the extent possible. Officers of the level of Asstt.COSCA and above should be transferred (ix) with the prior approval of this Ministry. For the above purpose, combined tenure of an officer means (x) total period of posting in Non Gazetted and Gazetted posts/ scale. (xi) The new policy shall be implemented and transfers shall be made from the new transfer session i.e. April to March and the officers shall be transferred at the beginning of the session.

व्यवस्था के अनुसार प्रायौद्वन् चर्र सक्षम स्तर से तकनीकी स्वीकृति अवश्य प्राप्त कर ली जायेगी तथा सक्षम स्तर से तुकनीकी हन्वीकृति प्राप्त होने के पश्चात ही कार्य प्रारम्भ किया जायेगा। माताओं को निर्माण कुर्रेसमेथ, सुनिष्पित किये जाने का पूर्ण उत्तरदायित्व कार्यदायी संस्था/विभाग का (2) होगा। प्रायोजना का निर्माण कार्य ससमय पूर्ण करा लिया जाना सुनिश्चित किया जायेगा। (3) स्वीकृत्व ध्रत्रौशि द्वित्ता चैयय वित्तीय हस्तपुस्तिकाओं के सुसंगत प्राविधानों, समय-समय पर शासन द्वारा (4) निर्गतः शैसनद्दिशौ मै निहित प्राविधानौ का अनुपालन करते हुये समयबद्ध रूप से सुनिश्चित किया जायेगा। स्वैकित धुनेशाशि का उपयोग स्वीकृत परियोजनाओं पर ही किया जायेगा, अन्यथा की स्थिति में किसी (5) प्र प्रिकारे की अनियमितता के लिये इसका समस्त उत्तरदायित्व विभाग का होगा। डैक्रंत धनराशि को कोषागार से एकमुश्त न आहरित कर आवश्यकतानुसार आहरित कर च्यय किया (6) जायेगा तथा आहरित धनराशि बैंक/डाकघर/पीएलए/डिपाजिट खाते मैं न रखी जायेग। विभाग द्वारा नियमानुसार समस्त आवश्यक वैधानिक अनापतियां एवं पर्यावरणीय क्लीयरैश सक्षम स्तर से (7) प्राप्त करके ही निर्माण कार्य प्रारम्भ कराया जाय। (8) प्रायोजनान्तर्गत प्रस्तावित कार्यो की द्विरावृति (डुप्लीकेसी) को रोकने की इष्टि से प्रायोजना की स्वीकृति से पूर्व विभाग द्वारा सुनिश्चित किया जायेगा कि यह कार्य पूर्व में किसी अन्य योजना/कार्यक्रम के अन्तर्गत न तो स्वीकृत है और न वर्तमान मै किसी अन्य योजना कार्यक्रम मै आच्छादित किया जाना प्रस्तावित  == 1.  यह शासनादेश इसेक्ट्रानिकली जारी किया गया है, अतः इस पर हस्ताक्षर की आवश्यकता नही है । 2-  इस शासनादेश की प्रमाणिकता वेब साइट http://shasanadesh.up.gov.in से सत्यापित की जा सकती है ।

No: DE/Acad/Health/2015/ Хоич Government of Goa, Directorate of Education, Porvorim- Goa. Dated :- C I R C U L A R Sub:- 2nd Round of National Deworming Day-10th August, 2016 The Director of Health Services, Directorate of Health Services, State Family Welfare  Bureau, Campal- Panaji has recommended to observe the "2nd Round of National Deworming Day" on  10th August, 2016 with an aim to intensify the efforts towards reducing the Transmission of Soil Transmitted Helminths among Children and on this day the Albendazole dose will be administered to all the Children between the age group  of 1 to  19 years and will be dewormed with a dose of Albendazole tablet on 10th August, 2016 followed by a mop-up day (MUD) on August, 17th, 2016 with the intention of deworming Children, for those who missed the dose on 10 th August, 2016. Therefore all the Heads of Government/Government Aided Primary/Secondary/Higher Secondary and Special Schools including the Anganwadi Centres and the Nodal teachers in the State of Goa are hereby instructed to arrange for  the programme of " National Deworming Day" on  10th August, 2016 as the Health officers of the PHC/CHC/UHC will be coordinating with the Educational Institutions of the area. Your cooperation for the successful implementation of this programme,  which is a National Priority is highly appreciated. ( Gajana) P. Bhat ) Director of Education To, The Heads of Govt./Govt. Aided Primary/Secondary/Higher Secondary Schools and special including the Anganwadi Centres in the State of Goa. F.No. 21/13/2009-FI( Vol.II-Pt.) Government of India Ministry of Finance Department of Financial Services 3 rd Floor, Jeevan Deep Building, Sansad Marg, New Delhi. Dated the 20 th January, 2014 To 1. The CMDs of all PSBs/ Chairman SBI 2. Chairman of all RRBs (through Sponsor Banks) 3. All SLBC Conveners Subject: Mapping of Gram Panchayat and Planning for BCA/CSCs for Direct Benefit Transfer-Sub Service Area Approach- Partial Amendment of   guidelines- regarding. Sir/Madam, This is regarding the coverage of those villages under Financial Inclusion Plan whose population is below 2000.  The guidelines of the Government in this regard may be seen in the letter of even No. dtd. 20 m December, 2012 wherein it was required that Sub Service Area (SSA) to be carved out through mapping of Gram Panchayats and such SSAs are to be allotted to banks for providing at least one banking facility (Branch/BCA). RBI had in terms of Monetary Policy Statement 2012-13, issued .2. guidelines for preparing of roadmap covering all unbanked villages of population less than 2000 for providing banking services in a time bound manner.  In terms of these guidelines banks should endeavour to have a Business Correspondent (BC) touch point in each village, to start with, at least once a fortnight. .3. Some Banks have pointed out that there is divergence between the guidelines of the Government and RBI.  In fact there is no divergence between RBI and Government guidelines.  If read together, the Government guidelines stipulate a stationary  Business Correspondent Agent ( BCA) in an SSA who can also cater to the needs of the nearby villages by fixing certain days in a week/ fortnight  to visit all other villages in the SSA. Thus the two guidelines supplement each other. 1/2

No.F.8(4)-E.III/79 Government of India Ministry of Finance Department of Expenditure | New Delhi, the . Jenuary,1980. OFFICE MAIORANDUM Subject:- Calculation of monthly contributions towards cost of pension payable during foreign service. In accordance with the instruction: contained in this Hinistry's OM No.F.1(14)-E.III(B)/69, dated the 19th July, 1969, the monthly contributions towards cost of pension payable during active period of foreign service is to be calculated on the maximum of the scale of pay of the post
plus Dearness Pay appropriate to such maximum. Consequent on the issue of this Ministry's 0.M. No.19(4)-EN/79, dated the 25th May, 1979, a doubt arises as to whether the portion of Dearness Allowance treated as pay for the purpose of retirement benefits would also be taken into account for the purpose of calculating the rate of pension
contribution parable for the period of foreign service.  Th The eresident is preased to decide that pension contributions' nayable in respect of a Government servant during the active period of his foreign service should be based on the maximum of the pay as defined in Rule 9(21) of the Fundemental Rules plus Deamess Pay appropriate to such maximum as indicated in
this Winistry's Of dated 25.5.79 in respect of the post held by him at the time of his proceening on foreign service or to vhich he may receive proforma promotion wiile on foreign ervice. These orders will apply to cases of foreign service ommencing after the date of their issue. In respect of past cases, these orders will be applicable in the event of any
further extension of the present term of foreian service from the date of such extension; or where the deputation was for an unspecified period, after one Year from the date of issue of these orders. . No.ENC(IW)/SE(P&M)/EE/DEE.2/AEE.5/005/MM/2_ Dt.01.08.2014 Sir, Sub: The Hon'ble Minister for Irrigation, Marketing, Mines & Geology and Legislative Affairs desires to discuss - issues related to the Irrigation Department - conduct a workshop with all Chief Engineers & Superintending Engineers at WALAMTARI on 03.08.2014. Ref: Note.No.28/PS/M (Irrgn, Mktg, M&G &LA)/2014, Dt: 31.07.2014. The Hon'ble Minister for Irrigation, Marketing, Mines & Geology and Legislative Affairs desires to conduct workshop with all Chief Engineers and Superintending Engineers of I & CAD Department at WALAMTARI on Monday 04.08.2014 @10:00AM to discuss and finalise the  issues related to the Irrigation Department listed below. 1. Preparation of guidelines and methods for de-silting of Minor Irrigation tanks and transportation and application of de-silted soil in the fields under EGS. 2. Reorganization Proposals of Irrigation Department keeping in view the priorities of the government consequent to the bifurcation of state.  3. Budget proposals for the projects for the year 2014-15 keeping in view of the priorities of Government. 4. Proposals for irrigation for 1 Lakh acre in every Assembly Constituency in Telangana State under Major, Medium and Minor and IDC schemes. 5. Proposals of Prioritization and Implementation of works of Pranahitha-Chevella. In this connection all the Chief Engineers, and Superintending Engineers are requested to make it convenient to attend the workshop at WALAMTARI on Monday i.e  4ª August 2014 @ 10:00AM with the related material for the above issues. Yours faithfully, J.Vijaya Prakash Engineer-in-Chief (IW) or Engineer-in-Ohief (IVV)

III Division) Indira Paryavaran Bhawan Aliganj, Jor Bagh Road New Delhi-110 003 Dated:  4th August, 2021 OFFICE MEMORANDUM Sub:  Uploading of Environment Clearance (EC) conditions –reg. This is to inform that Ministry is in the process of setting up a transparent, technology-driven, non-intrusive monitoring system through PARIVESH 2.0 (CPC- Green)", which would provide a "single window" solution for environmental regulations Environment clearances, Forest Clearances, Wildlife clearances, Coastal Regulation Zone, etc) administered in the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. The envisaged platform, inter-alia, includes the compliance module for capturing the compliance data on-line through the website for effective implementation of the EC conditions through technology driven platform. In order to achieve the desired result, it is required to convert the legacy data (EC conditions in the hard/ PDF format) into tabulated form as per the format available on the Ministry's website (parivesh.nic.in). 3. In this context, all the project proponents are requested to upload the desired information along with copy of EC letter(s) (PDF format) in the given format within a period of 2 weeks, after which the progress on the same shall be reviewed in the Ministry. In case of any technical issue, users may register their complaint through "complaint" button on Parivesh. Users may also contact the NIC technical team in the Ministry at 011-24695407 / monitoring-ec@nic.in . 4. GOVERNMENT OF KERALA Higher Education (K) Department CIRCULAR No: K1/152/18/H.Edn. Thiruvananthapuram, Dated: 18/05/2018 Higher Education Department - Afforestation Programme under Haritha Sub: Keralam - participation of College Students-Implementation by Institutions -Circular issued - regarding. 1. Letter No. SA2-2191/18 dated, 12.04.2018 from Principal Chief Ref: Conservator of Forest, Social Forestry, Forest Head Quarters, Thiruvananthapuram 2. Government Circular No. K1/49/2017/H.Edn dated, 22.04.2017 The Colleges and other institutions have been actively participating during the previous years in tree planting activity and joining the Forest Department and other Government organizations for the cause of saving environment and mitigating adverse effects of Global warming. The participation of college students has been appreciable. Like previous year, the tree planting activity is to commence on 5 th June 2018, World Environment Day. Although the programme is an ongoing one and instructions were already issued in the previous year, the following instructions are repeated again to ensure maximum participation in tree planting program. a) All the institutions will take part in this program through their students and plant trees in the coming monsoon season. b) Each institution will draw up a plan to motivate their students through various innovative activities such as debates, discussions, competitions on environment related issues, climate change and its dangerous consequences on our survival itself. c) A verification survey of the status of the plants distributed in the last year under the same scheme can be starter for the activities of this campaign.

अखिल भारतीय तकनीकी शिक्षा परिषद् (भारत सरकार का एक साविविक निकाय) मानव  संसाधन  विकास  मंत्रालय,  मारत  सरकार नेल्सन मंडेला मार्ग, वसंत कुज, नई दिल्ली - 110070 दूरमाषः 011-26131497 ई  मेल  :  ms@aicte-india.org सदस्य सचिव ALL INDIA COUNCIL FOR TECHNICĂL EDUCATION Prof. Rajive Kumar (A Statutory Body of the Govt, of India) Ministry of Human Resource Development, Govt. of India Member Secretary Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi-110067 Phone: 011-26131497 E-mail: ms@aicte-india.org F.No.61-3/RIFD/71b CPC/2016-17 Date: 18-03-2020 NOTICE All India Council for Technical Education has issued Gazette Notification dated 01.03.2019 on the pay scales, service conditions and minimum qualification for faculty positions in technical institutions. Accordingly, the minimum qualifications for teachers in institutions of Hotel Management and Catering Technology has been prescribed in para 5.1 (e) of the above Gazette Notification which reads as under: Minimum 4 years Bachelor's Degree in HMCT and Master's Degree in HMCT or in relevant disciplines with First Class or equivalent in any one of the two degrees. OR Minimum 4 years Bachelor's Degree in HMCT with First Class or equivalent and minimum of 5 years of relevant experience at a managerial level not less than Assistant Manager in α 4 – star Hotel or in α similar position in the hospitality industry/ tourism industry. Consequent upon the issue of Gazette Notification dated O1.03.2019 a number of representations have been received in this Council regarding the qualifications for faculty position in Hotel Management and Catering Technology as mentioned above. It has been brought to the notice of this Council that prior to the coming into force the Gazette Notification dated 01.03.2019, the minimum qualification for direct recruitment as an Assistant Professor in Hotel Management and Catering Technology Institutions was first class at Bachelor's (3-year degree or diploma (10-2) in HMCT) or equivalent at Master's Degree in HMCT with first class or equivalent either in Bachelor's or Master's Degree. As a result, AICTE has taken the following decision through its execultive committee followed by MHRD's approval vide letter dated 16th March 2020 as below: The candidates / incumbents having qualification of three years Bachelor degree in HMCT alongwith the other qualifications and experience as mentioned in AICTE Gazette Notification dated 1st March 2019 are eligible for the purpose of recruitment and promotion under CAS provided that the candidate has confirmed admission in 3 years Bachelor's programme in HMCT before publication of AICTE notification dated 1st March 2019 and produce an evidence of this admission. However, in all other cases qualifications published in AICTE Gazette dated 1st March 2019 shall be referred. Yours Sincerely (Rajive Kumar)

No. J-11013/41/2006-IA.II (I) Government of India Ministry of Environment and Forests Paryavaran Bhavan. C.G.O. Complex, Lodi Road, New Delhi-110 003 Dated: 30" December, 2013 OFFICE MEMORANDUM Subject: Consideration of Environment Clearance (EC) for UMPPs  Linked to Captive Coal Blocks. The matter regarding consideration of Environment Clearance (EC) for UMPPs linked to captive coal blocks has been raised by the Ministry of Power with this Ministry on several occasions and the same has been under the consideration of this Ministry. As regards Forest Clearance for a coal block involving forest land, linked to a UMPP, the Forest Clearance will be required to be obtained as per the provisions under the Forest (Conservation) Act 1980 and rules and guidelines framed there under. MoEF had constituted a Committee in March 2012 under the Chairmanship of the then Secretary, MoEF to formulate parameters for identification of inviolate forest areas.  The Committee has since submitted its recommendations which are now in the public domain. Till a final view is taken on these recommendations, MoEF would review the details of such linked coal blocks using the criteria suggested in the report. .3. Based on such a review, if the coal blocks in question do not fall under the category of inviolate areas, MoEF would consider granting environment clearance for UMPP, without linking it with the issue of EC and Stage-I Forestry Clearance of the linked coal block. To that extent, the provisions under Para 7 of the O.M. dated 19.04.2012 on the subject Consideration of projects of Thermal Power, Steel Sector, etc. for Environmental Clearance with sourcing of Coal from dedicated Coal Blocks / Coal India Ltd. - regarding" stand amended for UMPPs linked to captive coal blocks. Notwithstanding the above, grant of environment and forest clearances for the linked coal blocks would be decided only on the basis of merits of individual cases. By Speed Post/Fax/e-mail F.No.L-11012/01/2017-L&M Government of India Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers' Welfare Department of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare Krishi Bhavan, New Delhi. Dated: the 31" March, 2017 Meeting Notice Subject :  Discussion on Section 64 of the Multi State Cooperative Societies Act, 2002 –reg A meeting is hereby convened on 07 th April, 2017 at 11:00 A.M. under the Chairmanship of Joint Secretary (Cooperation) / Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies, to discuss on the provisions of Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002. All the addressees are requested to kindly make it convenient to attend the meeting in room no. 142 at Krishi Bhawan, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers' Welfare, Department of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare, New Delhi. The addressees are requested to confirm their participation along with their contact details by email at kamna.rajesh@gov.in latest by 04 th April, 2017. The discussion will focus on following issues : The kind of amendments required in Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002 with reasons, a. b. Sub-section (c) of Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002 is about investment of funds in shares or securities of any other multi state cooperative society or any co-operative society. Extent of cap or ceiling on such kind of investment. c. Sub-section (c) of Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002 is about investment of funds in shares or securities or assets of a subsidiary institution or any other institution . Extent of cap or ceiling on such kind of investment. d. Kind of risk mitigation measures being adopted by the multi state cooperative societies/banks while investing their funds/deposits. Various measures adopted by the multi state cooperative societies/banks to diversify the . investment portfolio with minimum risk. f. Safeguards adopted to protect the depositors' money.

No. Misc/P&AP/2022/6.39 Dated: 14.09.2022 CIRCULAR To, All Directors/Principals of AICTE Approved Institutions and All Vice Chancellor of Technical Universities, Subject: Second Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-II). Sir/Madam, Indian Air Force Ministry of defence in honor of Late Air Commodore Mehar Singh organizes Mehar Baba Competition. The first edition of the Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-I) was organized in Oct, 21 and second edition of the Mehar Baba Comeptition (MBC-II) has been launched on 06 Apr, 2022 by Hon'ble Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh. The theme of the competition is "Swarm Drone Based Foreign Object Detection on Aircraft Operation Surfaces". The competition will be conducted in four phases. Phase-O involves registration of all participants and short-listing of approximately 30 participants, based on the analysis of their proposals. Phase - 1 will have detailed presentation of the proposals by the 30 selected participants, and selection of 10 participants for continuing in next phase. Phase – 2 involves practical demonstration of prototype by the 10 selected participants as per the defined parameters and selection of five finalists. Phase-3 (Final Phase) will have demonstration of the complete capability as envisaged by IAF. The winners will be announced tentatively on 08 October 2023 (Air Force (Day). MBC-II has a clear aim, to stimulate the development of indigenous industries in the field of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS), and finding an innovative solution to detect Foreign Object Debris on aircraft operating surfaces, that will benefit the entire aviation industry. Although, a few of the technology ingredients of such a system already exist, the competition strives to build the final end to end solutions, to address the IAF needs. The Indian Air Force intends to disburse upto Rs. 13 Crores as R&D funds, award the winners a prize of Rs. 60 lakhs, and follow it up with a chance to participate in capital procurement of upto Rs. 300 Crores. Entries have to be submitted by 02 October 2022. Further details can be obtained by registering on the IAF webpage www.indianairforece.nic.in/meharbaba/ which has all the relevant details regarding the competition. Any further clarification and answers to queries can be sought from Squadron Leader Manoj Kumar, Project Officer, MBC-II on +91-9412727033 or Group Captain Neeraj Chaubey, Director Operations (MBC & RPA) on 011-23063703 (office) from Monday to Friday email-id: apathy51@nic.in or mcharbaba2022@gmail.com.

828573/2022/AD Section-MOCA-MOCA सचिव लीना नन्दन भारत सरकार पर्यावरण, वन एवं जलवायु परिवर्तन मंत्रालय  LEENA NANDAN SECRETARY GOVERNMENT OF INDIA MINISTRY OF ENVIRONMENT, FOREST AND CLIMATE CHANGE D.O. No. IA3-22/5/2021-IA.III 18th January, 2022. The Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) / Airport Authority of India (AAI) have undertaken several projects for improving regional connectivity through building new runways and airports, along with expanding many existing airports and their associated facilities. In this regard, I would like to inform you that the Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification 2006 issued by this Ministry on 14th September 2006, mandates prior Environment Clearance (EC) for construction of new projects or activities as well as for the expansion or modernization of existing projects or activities listed in Schedule 7(a) of the said notification. However, the EIA Notification provides that 'Air strips which do not involve bunkering/refuelling facility and or Air Traffic Control, are exempted'. In the last few years, this Ministry has taken several measures for streamlining 3. the system so as to ensure expeditious appraisal and timely grant of Environment Clearances. These measures, inter alia , include online submission and processing of proposals, standard Terms of Reference (ToR) for expansion projects, flexibility in baseline data collection etc. All applications for grant of EC are made online on the Ministry's portal: https://parivesh.nic.in . It is requested that the above may kindly be taken into account by the Ministry 4. of Civil Aviation during planning and execution of projects. In case of any clarification, the concerned officials from the Impact Assessment (IA) Division of this Ministry would coordinate and ensure further guidance. Yours sincerely, [ Leena Nandan ] Shri Rajiv Bansal Secretary Ministry of Civil Aviation Rajiv Gandhi Bhawan Safdarjung Airport Area New Delhi -110003 इदिरा पर्यावरण भवन, जोर बाग रोड, नई दिल्ली—110 003 फोन: (011) 24695262, फेक्स: (011) 24695270 INDIRA PARYAVARAN BHAWAN, JOR BAGH ROAD, NEW DELHI-110 003, Ph.: 011-24695262. Fax: 011-24695270 E-mail : secy-moef@nic.in, Website : moef.gov.in

To, The Principal / Director, All Affiliated Engineering colleges. Subject : General Instructions to the affiliated Engg Colleges regarding execution of Online examination. Sir / Madam, FE (2012 Course) (Semester I – Phase–I) Examination is to be conducted from 27/8/2013 to 31/8/2013. The General Instructions to the affiliated Engg Colleges regarding execution of Online examination and electronically distributed papers are as under : 1. Principal of affiliated college shall appoint Senior Supervisor for Conduction of Online Examination Phase-I, Phase-II & Phase-IV and examination by Electronic Distribution of Papers (EDP) for the subject of Engineering Graphics. 2. Password for electronically distributed papers will be sent to CEO of affiliated colleges, one hour before commencement of particular paper(s) / paper set(s) through registered mobile with University of Pune. Principals are requested to make an arrangement for downloading and making .193. copies of Engineering Graphics paper in examination control room at college only. Confidentiality shall be maintained. 4. Online examination shall be conducted as per the norms of online examination system. 5. After successful completion of every paper, Senior Supervisor shall take a printout of mark-sheet, sign and seal it. These envelopes shall be submitted to Examination section, University of Pune within three days from the date of last paper/online examination. Cont…/-2

Q/PG/575/01/2023 Ministry of External Affairs (PG Section) Dated :  28 July, 2023 To (1) All Ministries and Departments of Central Government (ii) All Ministries and Departments of State Governments Subject:  16 h Meeting of Protectorate of Emigrants (PoE) Establishment Board to fill up vacancies in the Offices of Protector of Emigrants It has been decided to fill up vacancies in the Protectorate of Emigrants offices located in the following cities on deputation basis: 1. Agartala 2. Bengaluru 3. Bhubaneswar 4. Chandigarh 5. Delhi 6. Hyderabad 7. Kochi 8. Mumbai 9. Patna 10. Raebareli 11. Ranchi .2. The vacancies to be filled up in the PoE offices are in the grades of Deputy Secretary/Under Secretary (minimum pay level-11), Section Officer (minimum pay level-08) and Assistant Section Officers (pay level-07). The details of the vacancies are attached as Annex – A. 3. The tenure in the PoE offices will be for a minimum period of two years on deputation basis, which can be further extended as per rules. The Protectors of Emigrants perform functions as assigned to them under the Emigration Act, 4. 1983, which inter alia include: To protect, and advice all intending emigrants. . . Oversee all the provisions of the Emigration Act, 1983 and compliance of rules made there- under. Granting emigration clearance to the intending emigrants as per the procedure prescribed . under the Emigration Act, 1983. . Monitoring recruitment activities of RAs, illegal agents under the supervision of the Protector General of Emigrants . Inspect, to an extent and in a manner as may be prescribed, any emigrant conveyance, or any other conveyance if he has reason to believe that any intending emigrant or emigrants are proceeding from, or returning to, India; to or from a place outside India by such other conveyance. Inquire into the treatment received by emigrants during their voyage or journey to, and . during the period of their residence in the country to which they emigrated and also during the return voyage or journey to India and report thereon to the Protector General of Emigrants or such other authority as may be prescribed. . Aid and advise, so far as reasonably as one can, emigrants who have returned to India.

G  Most Important By Speed Post No. R-11017/65/2014-L&M Government of India Ministry of Agriculture Department of Agriculture and Cooperation Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi Dated: 27 /05/2015 To, The Chief Executive Officer/ Managing Director /Secretary of the multi-State cooperative societies, (As per the list attached). Order of the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan at Jodhpur dated 14.05.2015 in D.B. Civil Sub: WP  No. 26/2013 in the matter of Sajjan Singh Bhati (Petitioner) Vs. State of Rajasthan & Ors. (Respondents) - Compliance of the above order by the multi-State cooperative societies in the State of Rajasthan - reg. Sir, I am to refer to the above mentioned subject and to say that the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan at Jodhpur vide order dated 14.05.2015 in D.B. Civil Writ Petition No. 26/2013 in the matter of Sajjan Singh Bhati Vs. State of Rajasthan & Ors. has directed that the no multi-State cooperative society shall accept deposits of any kind and under any scheme from public, including nominal members, ordinary members or the members of any category of these Societies, except after obtaining licence under Section 22 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 the restriction will, however, not apply for repayment of the deposits for a period of three months. If licences are obtained within three months under Section 22 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, multi-State Cooperative Societies in the State of Rajasthan may be allowed to accept the deposits." Society is therefore directed to comply the above directions as stated above. 2. Yours faithfully, (Ashish Kumar Bhutani) Joint Secretary (Cooperation) & Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies Copy to:- The Director General of Police, Rajasthan Police Headquarters Bari Chaupar, Jaipur- . 302002 The Chief Secretary, Government of Rajasthan, Secretariat, Jaipur-302005, Rajasthan 2. 3. Registrar of Cooperative Societies, Government of Rajasthan, Nehru Sehkar Bhawan, Bhawani Singh Road, Jaipur - 302001.
